name: Techniques for Organic Synthesis and Analysis
base_name: Techniques for Organic Synthesis and Analysis
long_desc: 09208 is the second of two chemistry laboratory courses required for the BS in biological sciences and the intercollege major in psychology and biological sciences.  It is also suitable for fulfilling the requirement for the laboratory experience for application to programs in the health professions. The course emphasizes experimental work in separations, synthesis, and analysis of organic compounds, including chromatography and spectroscopy. Written communication skills will be developed by means of laboratory reports and essays.  1.5 hr lec, 5 hrs lab

custom_fields.goals: Learn how to search for information about chemical hazards and waste. Work safely in a laboratory environment. Use proper handling and waste disposal for chemicals. Safely carry out laboratory techniques for synthesis, purification, and identification of organic chemicals. Describe at an appropriate level the principles and theory behind techniques. Assemble laboratory apparatus in a stable and safe structural arrangement. Manage time to allow for completion of work on schedule. Demonstrate ability to explain scientific concepts, experimental methods, and conclusions in writing.
custom_fields.key_topics: Organic chemistry laboratory techniques for synthesis, separation, purification, and analysis; record-keeping; written communication skills; lab safety; chemical handling.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Techniques in Quantitative Analysis (09207), and Organic Chemistry I (09217). Pre- or corequisite: Organic Chemistry II (09218).
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There are typically 7 - 8 lab reports, which provide for assessment of scientific writing, record-keeping, and logical thinking. Two exams test background knowledge and problem-solving abilities. Variable from year to year: problem sets (intended to help prepare for the reports), pre-lab quizzes (intended to test student preparedness before starting a new experiment).
custom_fields.relevance: This course is part of the laboratory sequence for non-chemistry majors. It reinforces material covered in organic chemistry lecture courses and provides hands-on experience with laboratory equipment and techniques as well as developing scientific writing skills. The course material is also relevant background for biochemistry, molecular biology, environmental chemistry and other courses that pertain to medical and material applications.
custom_fields.learning_resources: A lab manual specific to the experiments being performed, a textbook that covers techniques, on-line spectrum database, Canvas for on-line materials with Piazza enabled for discussion, weekly office hours offered by the instructor, occasional pre-lab lectures on non-lecture days (during the first part of the lab time)
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students are expected to work outside of class to complete assignments.
